title: Today's NYT Mini Crossword Answers for Wednesday, July 2
description: Here's today's NYT Mini Crossword answer. These answers will help you solve New York Times' popular crossword game, Mini Crossword, every day!

title: The Senate and the Supreme Court
description: President Trump’s agenda passed in the Senate. It now goes to the House. Plus, we take a close look at this Supreme Court term.

title: Supreme Court Agrees to Hear Cases Involving Transgender Athletes
description: The court announced it would hear challenges to state laws barring transgender youth from girls’ and women’s sports.

title: With All Eyes on Them, a ‘WAG’ Style Emerges
description: In the sports world, some wives and girlfriends are more famous than the athletes they are watching. Fashion brands have noticed.

title: Penn Agrees to Limit Participation of Transgender Athletes
description: In a deal with the Trump administration, the University of Pennsylvania will not allow transgender women to participate in women’s sports.

title: Court Reinstates Convictions in International Soccer Corruption Case
description: Hernán López, a former Fox executive, and Full Play Group, an Argentine sports marketing company, paid millions in bribes to secure the rights to broadcast soccer tournaments.

title: Wednesday Briefing
description: President Trump’s signature policy bill.

title: The House Passed Trump’s Big Bill, Showcasing His Power
description: Also, the U.S. labor market remained robust. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: How Trump’s China Tariffs Are Jeopardizing America’s Fireworks Extravaganzas
description: The pyrotechnics industry relies heavily on Chinese fireworks imports and warns that this could be the last big bang Fourth of July.

title: The Trick to Watching the Tour de France? Ignore the Stars.
description: Netflix’s new docuseries tries to wring drama from the best cyclists. But the real poetry is found among the riders surrounding them.

title: Dispute Over Golden Globes Heats Up
description: The Hollywood Foreign Press Association, which ran the awards show until a couple of years ago, has voted to investigate the deal that sold the event to a joint venture.

title: Russians absent from world chess top 10 for first time since official lists began
description: A poor outing from Ian Nepomniachtchi brought up an unlikely first but Serjey Karjakin made a strong comeback at Blitz last week

title: The Tour de France’s version of VAR? Get ready for yellow card controversy
description: Aggressive, dangerous or unsporting behaviour will be reviewed, as will ‘anything that arouses suspicion’

title: The IOC handed Los Angeles the Olympics. Trump is weaponizing them | Jules Boykoff
description: As the IOC ushers in new leadership, Donald Trump’s second term is already wreaking havoc on LA 28 – and turning a global celebration into a national security crackdown

title: David Porecki returns to Wallabies team to face Fiji after 643-day international absence
description: The Wallabies have opted for experience in their front row to face Fiji this weekend, with former captain David Porecki called back into the team

title: Carey and Webster steady Australia after more batting woe in West Indies
description: Half-centuries to Beau Webster and Alex Carey have helped Australia to 286 after batting first in the second Test against the West Indies in Grenada

title: ‘We’ll find another way’: England still believe they can fight back to defeat India
description: England’s assistant coach Jeetan Patel said: ‘There’s a lot of cricket to go,’ and that a win was possible, despite the side ending day two 510 runs behind

title: Wimbledon 2025: Draper loses to Cilic, Swiatek beats McNally – as it happened
description: Marin Cilic beats Jack Draper but there are wins for Iga Swiatek, Mirra Andreeva, Barbora Krejcikova, Jannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic

title: India bat England into submission as Stokes’ threadbare attack drags its feet | Andy Bull
description: An unforgiving pitch and some uninspiring bowling gave Shubman Gill’s tourists an inch … and they took a mile

title: Jack Draper knocked out of Wimbledon by inspired comeback kid Marin Cilic
description: Jack Draper joined the ranks of British men that are continuing to dwindle in the early stages of Wimbledon, losing in four sets to Croatian veteran Marin Cilic

title: Iga Swiatek stays under radar at Wimbledon with win against McNally to reach third round
description: Iga Swiatek went about her business almost unnoticed as she defeated Caty McNally 5-7, 6-2, 6-1 to reach the third round at Wimbledon

title: England v India: second men’s cricket Test, day two – as it happened
description: A glorious 269 from Shubman Gill, a record for an Indian captain, was followed by three late wickets to leave India in control at Edgbaston

title: Former world champion Julio César Chávez Jr arrested by Ice over alleged cartel ties
description: The former world champion’s son is being processed for removal from the US after Ice agents arrested him in California

title: England in Deep trouble on day two after Shubman Gill’s 269 piles on the pain
description: England are a massive 510 runs adrift of India having lost three quick wickets after finally bowling out the tourists for 587 on day two at Edgbaston

title: ‘I won’t be going anywhere’: George Russell adamant he will stay at Mercedes
description: George Russell believes he will get a new contract with Mercedes as he played down suggestions he could lose his seat to Max Verstappen

title: Wimbledon diary: Tarvet’s prize money mystery and Bear Grylls in the box
description: Amateur Tarvet will help fund British tennis’s future, Novak Djokovic brings back serve-and-volley, and celebrity spotting in the royal box

title: Wimbledon travel chaos is ‘huge embarrassment’ for London, says MP
description: Paul Kohler criticises Sadiq Khan after spectators face delays, cancellations and overcrowding on trains

title: ‘I executed perfectly’: Djokovic proves too much for Dan Evans at Wimbledon
description: Novak Djokovic said he was at the top of his game as he beat Dan Evans in straight sets to reach the third round at Wimbledon

title: Emma Raducanu confronts top-five struggles before Sabalenka showdown
description: Emma Raducanu will test the progression of her game in her Wimbledon third-round match against the world No 1, Aryna Sabalenka

title: Oisin Murphy fined £70,000 for drink-driving offence which led to car accident
description: Oisin Murphy, the reigning champion jockey on the Flat, was fined £70,000 after pleading guilty to a drink-driving charge following a crash

title: Broncos’ Chelsea Lenarduzzi: ‘It’s burnt me every year that we haven’t won’ | Jack Snape
description: Ahead of the 2025 NRLW season the Brisbane forward can still taste the bitter ending to last year’s campaign but knows you have to stick to the process

title: Owen Farrell backed to ‘inject experience’ into Lions squad after replacing injured Daly
description: Andy Farrell is flying out his son, Owen, to join the British & Irish Lions in Australia after Elliot Daly’s tour was ended due to injury

title: Idaho-bred Matteo Jorgenson is big – and getting bigger in cycling’s biggest races
description: Matteo Jorgenson has the size of a sprinter but climbs like a Tour contender. As the Visma rider eyes future glory, he’s biding his time in service of Jonas Vingegaard

title: Architect behind MCG’s Shane Warne Stand says mooted upgrades ‘don’t pass the pub test’
description: Marginal 5,000-seat increase ‘hard to justify’ given cost and rarity of ground reaching full capacity

title: Wimbledon 2025: Raducanu beats Vondrousova, Fritz survives, Osaka through, Paolini exits – as it happened
description: It was another busy day in SW19 as we moved toward the third round with Emma Raducanu and Carlos Alcaraz among those to reach round three

title: Raducanu revels in Centre Court joy after ‘one of the best matches I’ve played’
description: Emma Raducanu said: ‘I’m just so happy to have that level’ after her second-round win against Marketa Vondrousova at Wimbledon

title: England’s Woakes laments ‘frustrating’ marginal decisions going India’s way
description: Chris Woakes shared his frustration as Yashasvi Jaiswal and Karun Nair were saved by umpire’s calls after reviews on day one at Edgbaston

title: Yorkshire thrash Essex, Surrey and Notts held to draws: county cricket day four – as it happened
description: Alex Lees scored 156 for Durham as the runs piled up at the Oval, while Lancashire finally won a Championship match in 2025

title: ‘Most special day of my life’: world No 733 Tarvet enjoys limelight in Alcaraz defeat

title: Emma Raducanu storms past 2023 Wimbledon champion Vondrousova in style
description: Emma Raducanu won 6-3, 6-3 and will face the world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka, who beat Marie Bouzkova, in the third round

title: Carlos Alcaraz shakes off Tarvet from his back without inhibitions or regrets | Jonathan Liew
description: Carlos Alcaraz is essentially a magic-eye puzzle you can read in whatever way you want but has the inconsistency all but one of his rivals would dream of

title: Katie Boulter crashes out of Wimbledon with misfiring serve as Sonay Kartal advances
description: Katie Boulter exited Wimbledon after losing in three sets to the world No 101 Solana Sierra as Sonay Kartal advanced to the third round

title: ‘Like a kid in a sweet shop’: Brailsford back calling shots at Ineos Grenadiers
description: The former team principal will be present for much of this year’s Tour de France, with John Allert, the Ineos Grenadiers CEO, saying the 61-year-old is ‘a not-so-secret weapon for us’

title: Restrained Pant struggles as India’s new safety-first style fails to suit situation | Andy Bull
description: The batter was a model of self-control before being dismissed cheaply, with England having their three wishes granted in the second Test

title: Shubman Gill digs in for a ton to steady India and hold off England’s battling bowlers
description: India ended day one of the second Test on 310 for five after Shubman Gill racked up his second century of the series

description: Visitors search for first Test win at ground without Jasprit Bumrah as fans take in a mixed matchday experience

title: Max Verstappen reportedly in advanced talks with Mercedes over blockbuster move
description: Max Verstappen’s future with Red Bull is under scrutiny with reports that talks about a move to Mercedes have intensified

title: Wimbledon diary: England managers, SUVs and Jack Draper’s facial hair
description: Those hoping for Roy Hodgson and Thomas Tuchel to lead a sing-along from the royal box were sorely disappointed

title: NHL stars to return to Olympic ice in 2026 after 12-year absence
description: For the first time in more than a decade, the world’s best hockey players will take center stage at the Olympic Games

title: Cameron Norrie battles back from set down to stun 12th seed Frances Tiafoe at Wimbledon
description:
British No 3 Cameron Norrie beats 12th seed Frances Tiafoe 4-6 6-4
6-3 7-5 in the second round at Wimbledon

title: Andy Farrell plays down Lions full-back fears but Daly faces tour-ending injury
description: Andy Farrell has his ‘fingers crossed’ for Elliot Daly after the utility back suffered a potentially tour-ending injury against the Queensland Reds

title: ‘It makes water wetter’: How Wimbledon keeps grass green in soaring temperatures
description: Special soil spray is used to increase amount of water grass can absorb to prevent courts from drying out

title: British tennis player Jodie Burrage tells of online abuse after Wimbledon exit
description: British No 7 says some abuse appears to be from gamblers who have lost money as she calls on companies to ban trolls

title: Queensland Reds 12-52 British & Irish Lions: rugby union tour match – as it happened
description: Freeman bags a brace as Lions blow hot and cold in eight-try sweep in Queensland

description: The Lions scored eight tries in their 52-12 win over Queensland Reds as they came on strong in the second half

title: Tour de France 2025: stage-by-stage guide to this year’s race
description: On the 50th anniversary of the first Tour finish on the Champs-Élysées, we could be in for a cliffhanger finish

description: The HAC Cricket Club is rich in history and exemplifies the sport’s ability to endure upheaval and adapt

description: Krystal Niu, aka Red Panda, suffered a fall from her unicycle during the WNBA Commissioner’s Cup half-time show, drawing concern from fans and players alike

title: Debacle in the desert: will the Athletics’ $1.75bn stadium on the Vegas Strip ever be built?
description: It’s been over two years since the A’s were awarded public funding for their new ballpark. But despite last month’s “groundbreaking”, its completion is anything but certain
